title: Error in installing truffle in macOS
body:
## Issue

I am facing some issue in the installation of truffle. I used the command


```
npm install -g truffle
npm WARN deprecated flat@4.1.0: Fixed a prototype pollution security issue in 4.1.0, please upgrade to ^4.1.1 or ^5.0.1.
/usr/local/bin/truffle -> /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js

> truffle@5.1.40 postinstall /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle
> node ./scripts/postinstall.js

- Fetching solc version list from solc-bin. Attempt #1
+ truffle@5.1.40
added 123 packages from 68 contributors in 119.58s

```

However, my version is indeed v5.1.40
```
truffle version
Truffle v5.1.40 (core: 5.1.40)
Solidity v0.5.16 (solc-js)
Node v14.8.0
Web3.js v1.2.1
```

I'm new to Solidity and really don't know how to fix this. Please HELPPPPP!


* Operating System: Mac OS Mojave 10.14.6
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`):v5.1.40
* node version (`node --version`):v.14.8.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.14.7
@rexdai Did I miss something in the above question ? what exactly is your issue ? One thing I always do is uninstall completely and then install truffle again if I face any issues

> @rexdai Did I miss something in the above question ? what exactly is your issue ? One thing I always do is uninstall completely and then install truffle again if I face any issues

Hi, my problem is the "prototype pollution security issue" while installing",  ("WARN deprecated flat@4.1.0: Fixed a prototype pollution security issue in 4.1.0, please upgrade to ^4.1.1 or ^5.0.1.
/usr/local/bin/truffle -> /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js
" ), but as I can tell, my truffle version is already 5.1.40.

I've tried to uninstall using both "npm uninstall -g truffle" and "sudo npm uninstall -g truffle", and reinstall, but neither worked.

Hm, well firstly, Truffle doesn't support Node v14 ~~, but that doesn't appear to be the issue here.~~

~~How'd you install Node in the first place? Are you using NVM?~~  

**edit** Actually, maybe it is the issue. The output for `npm install -g truffle` looks right, and you wouldn't be able to run `truffle version` if it didn't get installed. What command are you running that's giving you that info about "prototype pollution"? Can you share the full output for that, please?
@gnidan Hi, thanks so much for replying! The command I ran and received the "prototype pollution" output is exactly `npm install -g truffle`, please see attachment for more details.

Hm, but that's just a warning...

Something we should look at, but are you able to use Truffle? It looks like you could probably ignore that warning. For instance: if you do `truffle test`, does it run?

We just dug in a bit, looks like `flat` is used by `truffle` via `mocha` via `yargs-unparser`. We recently did an upgrade of mocha, but we might need to look into this again.

(Noting this just for future investigation purposes; @rexdai you should still be fine, I think)

I've been having the same sort of problems getting started, I assumed i was doing something wrong. Am I?
![Screen Shot 2020-08-21 at 10 57 40 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68294677/90920729-aa9ce100-e39d-11ea-8946-30698e229826.png)

> I've been having the same sort of problems getting started, I assumed i was doing something wrong. Am I?
> ![Screen Shot 2020-08-21 at 10 57 40 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68294677/90920729-aa9ce100-e39d-11ea-8946-30698e229826.png)

I had the same issue and its related to the MacOS security settings. I solved it by using sudo npm install truffle -g

I do not recommend using `sudo` to install Truffle. There are sometimes a lot of other permissions errors that pop up when installing Truffle this way.

I think the best solution is to use `npm` with a Node version manager such as `nvm` and this is what `npm` recommends. See [this article](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally).

> Hm, but that's just a warning... > > Something we should look at, but are you able to use Truffle? It looks like you could probably ignore that warning. For instance: if you do `truffle test`, does it run? @gnidan Thank you for your help! Unfortunately, `truffle test` does not work. The error is apparently affecting the installation process.
Also, I don't think Truffle is fully compatible with Node 14 (because Ganache is not yet compatible with 14). Try downgrading to 12, re-installing, and seeing if it makes a difference.
@davidmurdoch just pinging you here so you can let the poster know when we have support for node v14!
OK, this should now be fixed with this week's release!   Please let us know if it's not.

Hi there, 

I am running into this issue right now. I was wondering what I need to do to get past this. I am following a tutorial to create a crypto swap app and the versions he uses are much older. I have found that v14 doesn't support truffle but you are saying this has been fixed as of Oct 2020. Please let me know.

I never resolved the issue

On Wed, Mar 17, 2021 at 8:31 AM williamrobertbush ***@***.***>
wrote:

>
> I am running into this issue right now. I was wondering what I need to do
> to get past this. I am following a tutorial to create a crypto swap app and
> the versions he uses are much older. I have found that v14 doesn't support
> truffle but you are saying this has been fixed as of Oct 2020. Please let

>

> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/3270#issuecomment-801179123>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AQJBQFJOMD7YEAAZP6G3Z33TEDDODANCNFSM4QAJESDA>
> .
>
Bummer. My mac is ancient and I can't seem to figure out how to downgrade to v12.
@williamrobertbush OK, we can reopen this.  Can you be more specific about what you're seeing?

Truffle is not compatible with Node v14. I cannot run a 2nd migration contract inside truffle. Truffle just will not allow it from what I understand. @blakcinc said the issue was never resolved. When I run truffle migrate, my 2nd contract will not deploy.

Hello, I tried everything to run Truffle. What can I do? I tried with node-v14.16.0 and with node-v15.12.0. 
![Screenshot 2021-03-27 at 22 27 16 copy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81491561/112750071-93bf0c80-8fc6-11eb-847b-e880771176b5.jpg)

im running into the same issue. I am using a 2018 iMac running iOS Big Sur. Please advise. I am also going through similar course that others have mentioned tried also without version and just install -g truffle

Truffle should have no problem running on Node 14. Once again, I don't recommend using `sudo` while installing Truffle. Use nvm with npm (as npm recommends) and you will avoid a lot of permissions errors. 

Check out [this article about using nvm](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally) from npm.
Hi @rexdai, we're closing this for issue maintenance. Please comment if you'd like us to reopen. Thanks!
has anyone been able to come to a solution for this? i even downloaded ### node v16.5.0 but it still had the ERR issues
i've fixed the problem with this command: **npm install -g npm**

> Also, I don't think Truffle is fully compatible with Node 14 (because Ganache is not yet compatible with 14). Try downgrading to 12, re-installing, and seeing if it makes a difference.

how can i downgrade please?
hi, I got the same EACESS problem, I finally just used homebrew to install nvm, so npn and node, then use brew as well to install truffle, smooth as silk :)

@kashicookie check this 
https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally

I have tried it with and without sudo but I still get the same thing. not sure what to do
